Bash(git -C "C:/Users/Brianna/Videos/1dollar" add config.yaml patterns.txt process_production.py run_processor.bat setup_windows.bat)

Bash(git -C "C:/Users/Brianna/Videos/1dollar" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add comprehensive fancy number patterns and Windows 64-bit support

- setup_windows.bat: Use py -3-64 to enforce 64-bit Python \(required for PyTorch\)
- run_processor.bat: Simplify error message to reference setup script
- patterns.txt: Add 31 regex patterns for fancy number detection including
  FIVE/SIX/SEVEN_OF_KIND, DOUBLE_QUADS, BOOKENDS, SUPER_REPEATER, MILLIONAIRE, etc.
- config.yaml: Add toggles for 40+ builtin pattern types with descriptions
- process_production.py: 
  - Add 40+ pattern detection methods \(trinary, flipper, ladder variants, etc.\)
  - Update classify\(\) to check all new patterns
  - Fix OCR to handle first-digit misreading \(G→6, B→8\) in addition to last-digit

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git -C "C:/Users/Brianna/Videos/1dollar" commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add sum patterns and counting ladder patterns

Sum patterns:
- Extended get_sum_category\(\) to flag sums 1-11 and 61-72
- These are collector-valued extreme digit sums

Counting ladder patterns \(8 new\):
- counting_2s through counting_9s
- Detects step patterns like 02040608, 03060912, etc.
- Works for both ascending and descending sequences

Coverage now at ~78 of 103 patterns from collector list.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
